resources.string: Tap, Tap Accessibility Service\n\nImportant Note: No data is collected from any of your apps, this service is simply used to keep the recognition active and provide interaction with the device

Tap, Tap Gesture Accessibility Service. 

You don't need to enable this if the app does not tell you to. It's only required for certain actions.

Important Note: No data is collected from any of your apps, this service is simply used to provide the gesture interaction with the device.

This is a separate service due to how Android works and how apps adapt their UI when services that can perform gestures are enabled. For example, Chrome will not hide the Omnibar on scroll with this service enabled.
Set the actions to be run when you tap on the back of your device twice
Set the actions to be run when you tap on the back of your device three times
Set situations when the gesture should not run an action
Set how the device notifies you when the gesture is run
Adjust the size of device to use when selecting the gesture model.
Vibrate once when the gesture is used and the action is run
Wake the device up if the screen is off (note: this will interfere with actions that turn the screen off!)
Blocks gesture for half a second after the device is plugged in
Run only when the device has just been plugged in (half a second limit)
Blocks gesture when the device is on a call. Only standard calls are supported - not VoIP eg. WhatsApp
Run only when the device is on a call
Blocks gesture for half a second when a USB device, such as a thumb drive, is plugged in
Run only when a USB device has just been plugged in (half a second limit)
Blocks gesture when any camera app is opened. Note: This will break the skipping functionality of the Launch Camera action.
Run only when the camera app is open
Blocks gesture when the device\'s screen is off
Run only when the screen is off
Blocks gesture when the device\'s screen is on
Run only when the screen is on
Blocks gesture when an app is showing on screen
Run only when an app is showing on screen
Blocks gesture when %1s is showing on screen
Launch your default camera app. This action will be skipped if the camera is already running.
Open the recents by simulating pressing the recents button. On devices that support it, using this action when recents is already open will switch to the first backgrounded app
Open the notification shade. On supported devices, this will close the notification shade if it\'s open.
Open the quick settings shade. On supported devices, this will close the quick settings shade if it\'s open
Take a screenshot using the system screenshot UI
Lock the screen by simulating the power button being pressed
Opens the power dialog by simulating the power button being held
Toggle the flashlight. This action will fail if the camera is in use by another app.
Launch %1s. This action will be skipped if it is already running.

Change the sensitivity of the gesture by adjusting how much force is filtered out as \'noise\'. A lower sensitivity means the gesture will be harder to do on most devices, whereas a higher sensitivity is more prone to false detection. Default is exactly in the middle.
Actions are tasks that are run when you tap the back of your device twice. Actions are run in the order of the list - top to bottom, and only if requirements are met.\nTap for more info.

Actions are tasks that are run when you tap the back of your device twice. Actions are run in the order of the list - top to bottom. If an action is able to run successfully, no further actions will be run. However, if an action is unavailable (eg. if the assistant for a "Launch assistant" action is already running, or if the requirements are not met), the next action below it will be run, and so on until one is run successfully.

Gates are situations that can block the gesture from running any actions. In order for any action to be run, all the enabled gates must be open.\nIf a scenario is currently met, for example if the screen is off and the "Display off" gate is enabled, no actions will be run. You can add as many gates as you like, and enable/disable them using the toggles (rather than having to delete and re-add) to make configuration quicker and easier.
Gesture Accessibility Service is enabled, but can be disabled
The gesture will not currently work. Tap to enable
Actions that require interaction with the screen, such as touches and gestures will not currently work. Tap to enable.
If you are experiencing issues with app behaviour, such as Chrome\'s Omnibar not scrolling, you may wish to disable this service.
This service is required for the gesture to work.
Select "Tap, Tap" from the accessibility service list, toggle it and return to Tap, Tap to continue
Select "Tap, Tap Secondary Service" from the accessibility service list, toggle it and return to Tap, Tap to continue
This app is in Beta. Tap for info.

This app is in development and has been released in a "Beta" state to allow for testing on lots of devices and suggestions from users. If you encounter a bug, please report it on the GitHub as an issue. If you would like to request a feature, post it on the XDA thread or request it on GitHub.\n\nThank you for your patience during development.
Created by Kieron Quinn / Quinny899 @ XDA\nWith thanks to contributions from the community, including: %1s
Tasker not installed or version not supported

In order to launch a Tasker task without using the Event plugin, you must enable the \"Allow External Access\" option in Tasker\'s settings. If you do not have this option enabled, this Action will always be skipped.
Show the system volume panel with the sound stream for adjustment showing
Increase the volume of the current sound stream
Decrease the volume of the current sound stream
Turn mute on/off for the current sound stream
Wake the device up if the screen is off. This overrides the setting in the feedback settings, is skipped if the display is on, and will not work if you have the \"Display off\" gate enabled
Switch between sound profiles of your device: Vibrate/Silent/Loud
Launch a shortcut such as Google Maps directions
This shortcut is currently not supported
You need to grant Tap, Tap the \"Phone\" permission to use this shortcut Action. Please grant it in your device\'s permission settings
Start or stop split screen mode with the current app (does not work when on the homescreen)

Experimental: Launch a reachbility-esque mode using split screen, with an empty top half of the screen and the current app on the bottom. Note: You may be required to reopen the current app when starting and ending this mode
Long press the notification icon to switch icon position
Vibrate when do not disturb is enabled
Ignore the device\'s DND setting and always vibrate when triggered
Blocks gesture when the keyboard is open and in use. Note that this may not always work if you are not actively typing.
Run only when the keyboard is open and in use. Note that this may not always work if you are not actively typing.
This will help keep Tap, Tap running (but not guarantee that it will always work, see the battery option below). Tap to disable.
Info on why Tap, Tap uses battery, and why it may be killed by your device when run in the background (and how to fix that)

Tap, Tap uses a background accessibility service to stay running and always be 'listening' for taps on the back of the device using the Accelerometer and Gyroscope. For this reason, Tap, Tap may use some battery while running in the background.

Due to its early development state, Tap, Tap has not been fully optimised yet, and battery life may improve through options in the future, but currently a slightly lower battery life is a consequence of having this feature.

Additionally, some OEM firmwares, such as MIUI or OneUI, are more aggressive at killing background tasks (including accessibility services) than Google recommends they should be. If Tap, Tap stops working on your device after being closed even with Battery Optimisation disabled, please try the following:
• Locking the app into memory (usually from the recent apps)
• Disabling any further battery optimisation for an app (usually under Settings > Apps or Settings > Battery)
• Disabling MIUI Optimization in the Developer Options (MIUI only)
• Setting Battery optimisation to "Don't optimise" in the app info (OnePlus only)

More info on apps being killed by the system and suggestions on how to resolve it for your device can be found at dontkillmyapp.com
Blocks gesture when the phone is in landscape orientation
Run only when the device is in landscape orientation
Blocks gesture when the phone is in portrait orientation
Run only when the device is in portrait orientation
Blocks the gesture when the device is placed down flat, for example on a table
Run only when the device is flat, for example on a table
Blocks the gesture when the proximity sensor detects an object. This blocks the gesture when your device is in your pocket, or flipped on a table
Run only when the proximity sensor detects an object. This happens when the device is in your pocket, or flipped on a table
Blocks the gesture when there is no wired or wireless headset connected. This is best used with the play/pause/skip controls to prevent music from playing over the speakers
Run only when there is no wired or wireless headset connected
Blocks the gesture when there is a wired or wireless headset connected.
Run only when there is a wired or wireless headset connected

This action will prevent any actions below it from being run as it is blocking (it will never be skipped).\nYou must add a requirement or remove this action if you want the actions below to be executed.
Blocks the gesture when there is music playing
Run only when there is music playing
Run only when there is no music playing
Blocks the gesture when there is no music playing

Changing the ringer mode requires Do Not Disturb access to be able to manage the Do Not Disturb state. Please grant the permission in the settings, by clicking below, selecting Tap, Tap, granting the permission and returning back to this screen.
Tap, Tap is running in the background. Tap to hide.
Notification used to keep Tap, Tap running in the background when the option to use a separate service is enabled
Advanced settings and tweaks to change performance and more

This setting enables the use of a second service that runs alongside the accessibility service. While seeming counter-intuitive, this may help the app not be killed by the system on some devices, as it is a foreground service and leaves the accessibilty service doing very little, relying on the second service for recognition and execution. You may need to reboot for this to take full effect.

These settings are experimental and may not work on your device, or may cause Tap, Tap to stop working entirely. If you find this happens, turn the settings to off and reboot your device, which should reset the service.

Attempt to automatically restart the Tap, Tap listener component once an hour. If you have split services enabled, the foreground service will be restarted too. Note: The Accessibility service cannot be auto-restarted, so if it is killed or disabled, this will not work.

A new update is available


Current version: %1s
New version: %1s
Update date: %1s
Changelog:
%1s
Notifications shown when the app checks for updates once a day
An update is available for Tap, Tap (%1s to %1s)
Triggers the Google Voice Access accessibility app, if it is running (this is NOT assistant or voice search)
Note: When triple tap is enabled, the double tap action may be slower to respond. This is due to the fact that it has to wait to see if a third tap will be performed before running the action.

This action presses the screen at the position the hamburger menu usually is.\nImportant warning: This will tap anything at the position where the menu usually is (top left), so will also sometimes go back, and may even tap other elements on the screen in that position, including other buttons. Use with extreme caution, consider using triple tap and app requirements to limit it.
Simulate the accessibility button, which can be used to trigger other services such as Select to Speak
Bring up the Accessibility Button\'s chooser menu
Trigger the Accessibility Shortcut. Make sure Tap, Tap is not set to use the shortcut before using this action!
Open the app drawer of a supported launcher. This only works on launchers based on Android 11.
Will trigger when the back of the phone is tapped twice
Will trigger when the back of the phone is tapped three times
Tap, Tap is now temporarily listening for double and triple taps. Try tapping the back of your device twice to check it\'s working.
Gesture recognised. Adjust the configuration to fit your preference below, then tap Next.
A lower sensitivity means the gesture will be harder to do on most devices, whereas a higher sensitivity is more prone to false detection
Adjust the size of device to use when selecting the gesture model. Currently selected: %1s

If the gesture is not working for you, here's a few things you can try to get it working:

• Try switching device size. While Tap, Tap attempts to guess the best size to use when choosing a model, it is not always correct

• Change the sensitivity - some devices may require a higher sensitivity

• Try tapping in a different position on the back. Sensors are located in different places on different devices, so you may find tapping higher, lower, or in a corner helps.

• Tap a little harder. Hold your phone securely while testing this, so you don't drop it, but a firm tap is easier to recognise than a soft one.

• Double tap quickly, but not too quickly - if you're too slow it may not register as a double tap (the cooldown time is about a second)
Tap, Tap is free and open source

Tap, Tap is and always will be free, building off open source components. The source code is available for anyone to view and make edits to at the GitHub repository. Official free downloads for the app are only available at XDA, the GitHub repository, and APKMirror. The official app will always automatically offer to download updates from GitHub, though the link may be direct and you may not see a page before the download starts.

Only install Tap, Tap from one of the official sources linked above. If you downloaded from any other source, it is highly recommended you uninstall it and reinstall from one of the links above. Tap for more info.

Tap, Tap uses an Accessibility Service. This gives it access to perform actions on your device automatically, and should not be granted to apps you do not trust. This is why Tap, Tap is open source - so you and everyone else who wants to can look at the code and verify it\'s not doing anything it shouldn\'t be.\n\nHowever, this guarantee does not apply if you downloaded the APK from a source other than the official locations. If you downloaded from anywhere other than the GitHub repository, XDA or APKMirror, it is highly recommended that you uninstall it immediately and reinstall it from one of the official locations.

If you like the Tap, Tap app and wish to make a donation, the link to do so is near the bottom of the settings. Regardless of whether you donate, your sharing and support and use of Tap, Tap is much appreciated, thank you!
Tap, Tap uses an accessibility service to keep running in the background, know what app is running and simulate events such as button presses, triggers and touches.
Tap, Tap will never collect data from your apps, and will never interact with your device when you have not performed the gesture.
To enable the service, tap the button above, select \"Tap, Tap\" from the opened list and flick the switch to enable it.\n\nYou may then need to press back twice to return to this app.

Tap, Tap needs to have battery optimisation disabled to prevent the system killing the background service. While the Android built in option to do so is below, you may need to disable other options on your device. Where available, a button is provided to open the settings on some devices.

"On devices with a dedicated accelerator for ML (such as a Qualcomm Hexagon Tensor Accelerator), battery usage will be low. On devices without this, you may experience a faster battery drain while Tap, Tap is enabled."
Note: The OEM battery button cannot react to the optimisation being disabled. If you already disabled it, you may continue.
Error starting battery activity. Please find and disable the optimisation your devices settings yourself.

This action requires the secondary (gesture) accessibility service to be enabled.\n\nNote: Enabling this service may cause UI and behaviour changes to some apps. For example, Chrome\'s Omnibar will not hide when scrolled.
Your device does not have the required sensor (a gyroscope) to use this app. Tap, Tap will never work on this device.
Switch to the most recent app by simulating double tapping the recents button (supported devices only)
Blocks gesture when the lock screen is showing
Run only when the lock screen is showing
Blocks the gesture when the lock screen is not showing
Run only when the lock screen is not showing
Set a custom sensitivity value for the gesture.\nImportant: Only use this if none of the built in sensitivity values are working for you
Blocks the gesture if an alarm or timer is going off
Run only when an alarm or timer is going off
Dismisses an alarm or timer, if there is one going off (supported Clock apps only)
Snoozes an alarm, if there is one going off (supported Clock apps only)
